article: I had never been much interested in sports. I had tried playing tennis, swimming and running but found nothing I liked. But 10 years ago, I found the right kind of exercise---  _  . Why did I start walking? At the age of twenty, my doctor told me I had a serious illness and  _  not live longer. I was so  _  then. I spent all of my life worrying. The doctor suggested that I should  take more exercise  . I didn't listen at first.  _  , after several months, I began to get the meaning of the doctor's words. While I was walking, I began to  _  flowers. I would stop and enjoy their beauty. I  _  found that I had missed the most beautiful part of life--- flowers, falling leaves, snow-covered houses. I had been wasting time worrying about  _  . Now I'm 35, and I don't worry any more about  _  may happen, Worry only makes me miss the good things in  _  . I want to say hello to everything because I'm living a new life.
